newsitem.title: UK: HORSE RACING-STOUTE CONFIDENT OF ENTREPRENEUR VICTORY.
newsitem.headline: HORSE RACING-STOUTE CONFIDENT OF ENTREPRENEUR VICTORY.

text.p: Michael Stoute was confident on Saturday that Entrepreneur could join the ranks of racing immortals with a convincing win in the Epsom Derby.
The trainer, fresh from his Coronation Cup triumph with globetrotting champion Singspiel, said of Entrepreneur: "This is the horse they all have to beat on Guineas form."
Entrepreneur showed blistering speed to land the Newmarket 2,000 Guineas and victory over the unique Epsom switchback would put the stamp of greatness on Entrepreneur.
"Entrepreneur has never worked over the full Derby distance but he has galloped and cantered round a left-handed track so I am very hopeful that he will handle Epsom," Stoute said.
Victory would fulfil a lifetime ambition for former bookmaker Michael Tabor who has been a phenomenally successful owner around the world and already captured a Kentucky Derby with Thunder Gulch.
Bookmakers are expecting a 30 million pounds ($48.9 million) betting bonanza on the world's most famous horse race -- even if Entrepreneur is virtually unbackable for small-time punters at 4-5.
They will be looking for good each way value in the 13-horse field who might just surprise Entrepreneur and his jockey, big race specialist Michael Kinane.
The grey Silver Patriarch (11-2) scored a facile victory in the Lingfield Derby trial over a similar track and overnight rain at Epsom on Friday will have helped his chances.
French champion trainer Andre Fabre, who has just won his first French Derby with Peintre Celebre, hopes to complete the Epsom double with Cloudings (10-1).
But all the form lines keep coming back to Entrepreneur, the class act of the race whose victory will have a bittersweet taste for Stoute.
For his long-time stable jockey Walter Swinburn has taken a sabbatical from racing to battle weight problems after an horrific fall in Hong Kong.
"I wanted so much to ride him at Epsom," Swinburn told the London Evening Standard.
"In fact I've turned away from a champion. No one knows that better than me but my body was in trauma," he said.
And Swinburn, who as a teenager partnered the mighty Shergar to a breathtaking 10-length win in the 1981 Derby, paid Entrepreneur the ultimate compliment.
"He has far more speed than Shergar who was an outstanding galloper of great quality. And don't believe anyone who tells you a horse as fast as him won't stay."
